notifySubscriber

public void notifySubscriber(short publication_id,
                             java.lang.String publicationTopic,
                             ArgArray inArgs)
                      throws OpException
Description copied from class: FunctionBlock
required method for SubscriberCallback. This method is provided so that sub-classes do not need to do anything if they want to ignore publications. Typically, a class which inherits from FunctionBlock will override this method with its own.

Specified by:
notifySubscriber in interface SubscriberCallback
Overrides:
notifySubscriber in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
publication_id - The ID which was passed into the SubscriberPort when subscribing to topic
publicationTopic - The topic that the publication was published on.
inArgs - The payload which was published.
Throws:
OpException

destroy

public void destroy()
Invoked to destroy a block instance and clean up the internals. Remove any background threads so the object can be cleanly deleted.

Overrides:
destroy in class FunctionBlock

configure

public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
configuration - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

Name Default Description
BasicTransducerBlock.autoStart true When true, the block will begin sampling immediately. When false, the startSampling method must be utilized to begin sampling.
BasicTransducerBlock.transducerName   The name of a TIM to use when reading or writing. The TIM instance is looked up by this name.
BasicTransducerBlock.period 10 seconds A periodic sample rate. Measurements specified by BasicTransducerBlock.readList are generated at this rate. A period less than or equal to zero will result in no periodic measurements being made. A period of -1 (or <0) will set the eventsAllowed property to true if eventsAllowed is not specified.
BasicTransducerBlock.periodOffset random Specifies a time in seconds to offset the regular measurements. The schedule will fire every period seconds, at modulo period plus periodOffset.
BasicTransducerBlock.eventsAllowed false Some TIMs can generate data asychronously from a scheduled measurement request. If this property is true then these events are published as if a normal scheduled read was performed. If this propery is not set and the schedule is set to -1 (or < 0) then eventsAllowed is considered to be true.
BasicTransducerBlock.readList all A Vectorof channel names to read. Use all for all channels.
BasicTransducerBlock.useGlobalTimer true A Boolean true or false. When true, a single global timer instance is used to schedule measurement for all BasicTBlockWorker instances. When false, each instance will have it's own timer. Some J2ME environments limit the number of active threads so setting this to false can lead to Exceptions if the number of allowable threads is exceeded since each Timerinstance has it's own thread.

One side affect of setting this to true is that measurements may not run exactly on schedule since they will be essentially serialized by the single Timer. If running exactly on schedule is important for the application then set this property to false.
BasicTransducerBlock.schedule   A Vector of schedule configurations. When this form of specification is provided the above elements (readList, useGlobalTimer, period, periodOffset, transducerName, pubname) are not utilized. Use of this form allows multiple transducers to be specified. Each schedule configuration consists of an ArgArray of elements defining each schedule. The following ArgArray elements are supported:
Name Default Description
period 10 seconds A periodic sample rate. Measurements specified by BasicTransducerBlock.readList are generated at this rate. A period less than or equal to zero will result in no periodic measurements being made. A period of -1 (or <0) will set the eventsAllowed property to true if eventsAllowed is not specified.
BasicTransducerBlock.eventsAllowed false Some TIMs can generate data asychronously from a scheduled measurement request. If this property is true then these events are published as if a normal scheduled read was performed. If this propery is not set and the schedule is set to -1 (or < 0) then eventsAllowed is considered to be true.
useGlobalTimer true See description for BasicTransducerBlock.useGlobalTimer
readSpec   A Vector of channels to read. Each channel specifies the transducer and channel list.The following ArgArray elements are supported:
Name Default Description
transducerName   The name of a TIM to use when reading or writing. The TIM instance is looked up by this name.
readList all A Vectorof channel names to read. Use all for all channels.
recordName auto generated When multiple readList elements are specified for a schedule it is possible that they may have measurement record names in common. Specifying recordName adds a prefix to every measurement name placed into the result record so they can be distinguished.
trigger   The name of a subscription to listen for trigger events. Receipt of any publications on the associated subscription port will initiate a read on this schedule.

Note that this is not the topic name but rather the name of the subscription port to which a topic has been associated. See FunctionBlock.configure(ArgArray) for more details on configuring subscriptions.
pubname   The name of a publication used to publish a reading.

Note that this is not the topic name but rather the name of the publisher port to which a topic has been associated. See FunctionBlock.configure(ArgArray) for more details on configuring publications.
enab   The name of a subscription to listen for enable publications. Any publications received on this subscription port are evaluated against the condition specified by the condition property defined below. If the condition evaluates to false, then no measurements are read on this schedule. If the condition is true then measurements are enabled. This can be used as a gating function to control when scheduled measurements actually are allowed.

Note that this is not the topic name but rather the name of the subscription port to which a topic has been associated. See FunctionBlock.configure(ArgArray) for more details on configuring subscriptions.
enableCondition   A condition expression used to evaluate any incoming publicaions for the enable property described above. The form of the condition is as described by the ConditionEval class.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FunctionBlock.configure(ArgArray), ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)
